item.title: TLS/SSL (Transport Encryption)
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Run MongoDB with TLS/SSL (Transport Encryption) KubeDB supports providing TLS/SSL encryption (via, sslMode and clusterAuthMode) for MongoDB. This tutorial will show you how to use KubeDB to run a MongoDB database with TLS/SSL encryption. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using kind.
